title: Understanding the Problem
text: One use for the derivative is to analyze motion along a line. Let s(t) be a function giving the position of an object at time $$t$$. The velocity of the object at time $$t$$ is given by v(t) $$=$$ s'(t), the derivative of s(t). First, set s(t) to $$0$$ and solve for $$t$$.
speech: One use for the derivative is to analyze motion along a line. Let s(t) be a function giving the position of an object at time  t . The velocity of the object at time  t  is given by v(t) , is equal to,  s'(t), the derivative of s(t). First, set s(t) to  0  and solve for  t .

title: Setting s(t) to $$0$$
text: The problem asks us to determine the velocity $$\frac{ft}{s}$$ of the car when s(t) $$=$$ $$0$$. Solve for s(t) $$=$$ $$t^2$$ - $$3t$$ - $$4$$ $$=$$ $$0$$.

title: Solving for $$t$$
speech: What is  t squared minus 3 t minus 4 is equal to 0 ?
pacedSpeech: What is   t squared minus 3 t minus 4 is equal to 0

title: Time When s(t) $$=$$ $$0$$
text:
$$t^2-3t-4=0$$
$$t= rac{3\pm \sqrt{3^2+4	imes4}}{2}$$
$$t= rac{3\pm 5}{2}$$
$$t= rac{3+5}{2}= rac{8}{2}=4$$ and $$t= rac{3-5}{2}= rac{-2}{2}=-1$$
Because time can only be positive, the time in which s(t) $$=$$ $$0$$ is $$4$$.

title: Velocity Function
text: Now that we have determined that $$t$$ $$=$$ $$4$$ when s(t) $$=$$ $$0$$, we can plug the time into the velocity function given by v(t) $$=$$ s'(t), the derivative of s(t). Solve for the velocity function.

title: Plugging in Time
text: Plug $$t$$ $$=$$ $$4$$ into s'(t) $$=$$ $$2t$$ - $$3$$ to determine the velocity $$\frac{ft}{s}$$ of the car when s(t) $$=$$ $$0$$.
